result.execSummary:
The defendant Dawn R Sindowski was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Manufacture/Deliver Heroin (<3g), a class F felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(1)(d)1.
  • Possession of Narcotic Drugs, a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(am).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

Court called 3:01 PM. Defendant, Dawn R Sindowski, appeared. Jane E. Kohlwey appeared for the State of Wisconsin. States position of request is no objection. Court will lift order that defendant may have now contact with R.S. Court adjourned 3:04 PM.

Defendant Dawn R Sindowski in court with attorney Mark D. Lawton.  Jane E. Kohlwey appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   Cases called: 14CF464 & 14CM496. In 14CM496 Victim impact statement filed by DA Kohlwey.  In 14CF464  Waiver of Preliminary Hearing filed. Court found probable cause, bound defendant over.  Information filed, reading waived.  Defendant plead no contest to Cts. 1 & 2.  Court found guilty.  Judgment was entered.  Ct. 1  Court withheld sentencing placed defendant on probation for 6 years.  $518.00 costs/fines.  Restitution $389.13 from case 14CM496.  AODA and comply.  Submit DNA sample.  Psychological evaluation and comply. Maintain absolute sobriety.  No contact with R.S.  Ct. 2;  9 months jail with Huber work release, and treatment release.  $518.00 fines/costs.  47 days jail credit due.  Dismiss but read in Cts. 3, & 4.  Dismiss but read in all charges on 14CM496.  Jail start 12-8-14 at 7:00 p.m.
